programme.title: Les ambassadeurs
programme.desc:
The Ambassadors take to song
Armelle begins her journey in the company of France Brel, a gentle voyage that also takes her to Brussels, and an encounter with Marie Warnant and Lubiana. We also catch up with Saul in Soignies, Aprile in Pays de Herve, BJ Scott in Verviers and Yousself Swatt's in Tournai...

programme.title: En route vers les sommets
programme.desc: Mountain fever The first acclimatisation climb: Deadman's Peak at 5,400 metres. Despite the warnings from Roman Hari, the expedition's mountain doctor, the boys want to go too high, too quickly and soon discover the effects brought on by the altitude. Director: Martin Schilt (season 2, Switzerland, 2021)

programme.title: Ding dong : montre-moi ta maison !
programme.desc:
Episode 2
Viola begins by offering us a tour of an amazing house, its roof and walls covered by solar panels. Then she visits a surprising home-workshop-studio belonging to an artist-shepherd and a magnificent villa with direct lake access and an owner who is somewhat unusual ... to say the least.
Presented by: Viola Tami. Directed by: Karen Ballmer (Switzerland, 2021)

programme.title: Les saisons de Pique-assiette
programme.sub-title: Fregola aux coques, fèves et artichauts
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Chroniques d'en haut
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Welcome to the Paris City Hall, or Hôtel de Ville. Consume less but consume better, we discover the new paradigm in the world of alternative fashion. An encounter with Sakina M'Sa, enlightened designer and businesswoman. How to say it with flowers? Focus on the "makhila", the distinctive Basque walking stick. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: #VF
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #VF
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Les ambassadeurs
programme.desc: The beautiful villages of the Pays de Herve We take a wander through the Pays de Herve, in the Province of Liège, from one beautiful village to the next: Olne, Soiron, Clermont-sur-Berwinne. So many delightful spots to take a break amidst the patchwork of fields, copses and hedgerows, the stone-built houses and the footpaths. Presented by: Armelle, Guy Lemaire, Jean-Philippe Watteyne.

programme.title: En route vers les sommets
programme.desc: Change of plan Bad weather curtails the expedition. The precious weather report arrives from Switzerland, much delayed. When an improvement is announced, the team can finally concentrate on preparing the final climb, that of Xuelian Feng. But people disagree on which route to take. Director: Martin Schilt (season 2, Switzerland, 2021)

programme.title: Ding dong : montre-moi ta maison !
programme.desc:
Episode 3
We set off to meet the owners of sumptuous and remarkable homes in Meilen (canton of Zurich), Graubünden and Saint-Gall. A fascinating immersion in their daily lives and their past...
Presented by: Viola Tami. Directed by: Karen Ballmer (Switzerland, 2021)

programme.title: Les saisons de Pique-assiette
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Chroniques d'en haut
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of a familiar yet little-known Paris monument, the Petit Palais. Between porcelain and jewellery, Alix D.Reynis reinvents jewellery inspired by history. Paris on film, in the footsteps of Amélie Poulain. Focus on Ateliers Baudin where Jurassic tradition takes on contemporary style with bespoke eyewear in horn frames. Presented by: Katherina Marx

programme.title: #chicenVF
programme.desc: A breath of fresh air in the world of design with Éric Schmitt. A bucolic rendezvous in a world of timeless creations. Embroidery is far from being old-fashioned and out-of-date. In the expert hands of the textile artist Estelle Delphin Lobel it becomes a veritable art form. Commentary: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: Voyages vert vous
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Les ambassadeurs
programme.desc: The beautiful villages of the Pays de Herve We take a wander through the Pays de Herve, in the Province of Liège, from one beautiful village to the next: Olne, Soiron, Clermont-sur-Berwinne. programme.title: Une brique dans le ventre
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Épicerie fine
programme.desc:
Royan Atlantique
We set our heading for the Royan Atlantique where Sébastien fishes by eye and ear. Brice talks about his passion for salt. Focus on the white storks and other birds nesting in the region. All about the oyster huts of La Tremblade.
Presented by: Guy Martin Directed by: Émilie Darnaud (France, 2022)

programme.title: La tête à l'endroit
programme.desc: Does Chalon-sur-Saône have a good image? Does the place of birth of Nicéphore Niepce, who invented photography, have a good image? To find out, Guillaume sets off to discover this small mediaeval town, the birthplace of photography. Presenter: Guillaume Pierre.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at the Cité du Vin in Bordeaux. Encounter with the French Michelin-starred chef Guy Savoy in his restaurant at the Monnaie de Paris. Three addresses for all things Greek. Alice Riehl brings porcelain out of the kitchen to create a host of poetic sculptures and murals. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: #chicenVF
programme.desc: Experimenting, mixing and matching, collections of every possible description... An immersive visit to the fascinating world of Daniel Rozensztroch, artistic director. Being a man, or woman, of straw isn't always a bad thing. To convince you, an encounter with Célia Suzanne, specialist in straw marquetry. Commentary: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: Les ambassadeurs
programme.desc: The beautiful villages of the Pays de Herve We take a wander through the Pays de Herve, in the Province of Liège, from one beautiful village to the next: Olne, Soiron, Clermont-sur-Berwinne. So many delightful spots to take a break amidst the patchwork of fields, copses and hedgerows, the stone-built houses and the footpaths. Presented by: Armelle, Guy Lemaire, Jean-Philippe Watteyne.

When an improvement is announced, the team can finally concentrate on preparing the final climb, that of Xuelian Feng. But people disagree on which route to take. Director: Martin Schilt (season 2, Switzerland, 2021)

programme.title: Tendance XXI
programme.desc:
Season 7, episode 9:

Place Vendôme, spotlight on the jeweller Lorenz Bäumer. All there is to know about the kiss. Chausse Mouton has turned the traditional French carpet slipper into a modern accessory, whilst continuing to respect traditional French techniques. How to wear a sweater dress? Portrait of Roger Vincent, pipe carver in Saint-Claude.

Commentary: Viviane Blassel.

programme.title: Succulent !
programme.desc:
Rum baba
We rediscover this great classic desert: the rum baba. And even when prepared completely by the book, a little touch of fantasy is always possible, such as today's recipe, flavoured with rhubarb wine.
Presented by: Marie Montuir

programme.title: La belle vie
programme.desc: Life on a floating island We head to Freedom Cove, a floating island built thirty years ago by Catherine and Wayne, a couple of artists. Impressed by the audacity of the project, Julien explores the challenges of life on the water, totally independent in terms of energy and food. Presented by: Julien Roussin-Côté.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #chicenVF
programme.desc: Fun, colourful and made in France, Jean-Simon Roch's creations impress both young and old alike. The designer invites us to explore his magical world. Then, to discover all there is to know about wood, we meet the cabinetmaker Morgane Ricada. Commentary: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: Vachement Normand !
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Ricardo
programme.desc:
Muffin recipes
Ricardo suggests a selection of muffin recipes for a filling snack easy to eat on the go: apricot muffins, sweetcorn muffins and pear, date and cream cheese muffins.
Presented by: Ricardo Larrivée.

programme.title: Littoral
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.desc: Welcome to the Paris City Hall, or Hôtel de Ville. Consume less but consume better, we discover the new paradigm in the world of alternative fashion. An encounter with Sakina M'Sa, enlightened designer and businesswoman. How to say it with flowers? Focus on the "makhila", the distinctive Basque walking stick. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: #chicenVF
programme.sub-title: Joran Briand et Arnaud Berthereau/Le papier
programme.desc: From western France to Paris, the designers Joran Briand and Arnaud Berthereau bring their very French touch to the world of design. Paper isn't just for writing on, in the hands of Sandrine Beaudun it's transformed into delicate sculptures, as light as air. Commentary: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: Les ambassadeurs
programme.desc: The beautiful villages of the Pays de Herve We take a wander through the Pays de Herve, in the Province of Liège, from one beautiful village to the next: Olne, Soiron, Clermont-sur-Berwinne. So many delightful spots to take a break amidst the patchwork of fields, copses and hedgerows, the stone-built houses and the footpaths. Presented by: Armelle, Guy Lemaire, Jean-Philippe Watteyne.

programme.title: Version Française
programme.desc:
A visit to the Cognacq-Jay Museum, home to the 18th century artworks collected by Ernest Cognacq and Marie-Louise Jay. Interior designer Bruno Borrione advocates an uninhibited style using materials with character. Glenn Martens brings a fresh look to the Jean Paul Gaultier fashion house. All the expertise of Peruke.
Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: 5 chefs dans ma cuisine
programme.sub-title: Croustade aux pommes et aux courges
programme.desc: Apple and squash croustade Blake Mackay prepares a croustade that combines squash and apple to perfection. And to ensure nothing goes to waste, the apple skins and core are used to create home-made vinegar. Presented by: Marina Orsini. Directed by: Nicole Dussault, David Gauthier, Stéphane Rocheleau, Léo Boulanger (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Nos maisons
programme.desc: Bungalow Built to house families after the baby-boom, Quebec's bungalows are typical of the suburbs, each with their rectangular layout, basement and carport. Directed by: Mathieu Baer (Canada, 2019)

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Monte-Carlo Riviera
programme.desc:
The story of the only woman to rule Monaco: Princess Louise Hippolyte. A visit to the Centre Botanique de Monaco and its exceptional collection of cacti and exotic plants. We also discover the Fête de la Saint-Éloi, in Tende in the Roya Valley. An immersive exploration of the Agriates Desert in Corsica.
Presented by: Cyril Viguier.

programme.title: #chicenVF
